body.p:
The Asmoneon was placed in my
hands today. And I was ? to find that Mr Jacobs
had not withdrawn his letter.—I shall make but
little commentary on it, except that he has done
the same that he charges you with, he has attacked
the B. E. Congregation, and I would not wonder if Dr
Myer did not reply to him—my opinions of
the attack on yourself I sent to Solomon who handed
it over to you. Dr. Myer called tonight
and enclosed I give you the commentaries.
Paraphases or glasses, which ever they may
be called of Sie celebrated authorities, which
you maybe not have at hand, Dr Myer
also discovered that Jacobs quotation from the
Midrash was incorrect, several words left
out.—I also enclose the correct quotation
which may also be of service to you, I should
like to s? to furnish as many authorities
as possible to show that they are accessible
to you. While those be quotes, are to be found
in Mendlesons Bible, in the hands of every german
schoolboy—and serves to show his shallowness
not to know a true and Literal translation
from a gloss or commentary or paraprase.
I wrote to Dr. Eckman. he promised to

write, to you, I enclose you a letter Recd from
him in reply to a letter addressed him by Mr
Levin & myself.—which letter simply requested
a true and literal version of the verse in question.
Mr Levin was dissatisfied with it, he believes
Jacob before Dr E. I am seriously
grieved about the thing, and should like a
reply to be published in the asmonean, —but
I would not condescend to day any more than
that you have made it an invaluable rule
not to answer any personal attacks, but
for the benefit of the literary public or the
readers of the Asmoneon you give the different
renderings of the verse in question, also
the various commentaries and paraprases
and leave him to the contempt he merits,
He deserves to mend or cut to pieces, and
I believe there is enough in the article to
excite the revengeful passions of most men
but show ? above it.

The Liberty of the Press is in danger!!!
A printed sermon is sent to a public journal?
for notice, and forsooth because he does not
laud the author in undeserved terms,—the Editor
is called to account in a scurrilous manner
and personally abused, and extraordinary & unfounded charges
brought against him, and this in America in the XIXth Century
O tempora, O mores.

If you reply show a plain statement of the case
Jacobs does not quote his (rendering) or the rendering
out of your translation,—the world does not know from
his article but that you have grossly misused him, this
was no doubt done on purpose.—I would state it thus
The true and liberal version of the following passage from Exo. 33,14
by the Rev Solomon Jacobs of Charleston

Hebrew, I will be with them now. that
which I will be unto them hereafter

The true and literal version of Exo 33, 14.
by Isaac Leeser ser. translation of Pentatuch
Hebrew I will be that I will be.

Isac Leeser charges Rev S Jacobs with giving paraphrase
instead of a true and literal version„
then give all your authorities.

Your excitable disposition or temper is well known
and this is thrown out as a bait to entrap you into
some remark which might fall from you which
could be malaise? to work upon.—do not be
annoyed with me for writing so plainly.—but
take my advice, only publish your authority
addressed to Editor of Asmoneon,—and leave Jacobs
to smother in the smoke he himself has created,—

and do not take any notice of the man or his
letter (query! did he compose the whole of it) in the pages
of the Occident—he made a remark to me that
you made him famous by publishing his procedings?
of the Congregation and Jacobs election to the office
together,—he might have passed unnoticed but
for your note,—do not make him famous
any more. I have the Cacoethes Scribendi
but I leave the field to abler and better
hands. I hope
Dr Myer will Reply
to him—if he does,—he will richly deserve
it the congregation B E are bad enough but they
do not repudiate the opinions of orthodox divines?.
that is a? charge against them
for a man who from the pulpit, pledged himself
(I heard him) that his mission was peace, that he
would endevour to show them the true way, but
that he would not become personal or interfere
with the belief or opinions of the B E Congregation.
In his sermons on the Oral Law.

The Yakut Reubne? gives an acrostic on the letter of the words.
Naclemander is very philosophical. The Saadiah
I have heard Dr. E speak of as being great authority
The Aben Ezra quotes Remban and Midrash which
Dr Myers did not consider important to rewrite.
